drug.name: Gluconic Acid
drug.description: Commonly found in salts with sodium and calcium. Gluconic acid or gluconate is used to maintain the cation-anion balance on electrolyte solutions.
drug.indication: For use as part of electrolyte supplementation in total parenteral nutrition [FDA Label].
drug.pharmacodynamics: Used as part of electrolyte salts to maintain cation-anion balance in solutions.

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as sugar acids and derivatives. These are compounds containing a saccharide unit which bears a carboxylic acid group.

product.name: Lypholyte Multi-electrolyte Conc Inj
product.labeller: Lyphomed, Division Of Fujisawa Canada Inc.

product.labeller: Guardian Laboratories, Division Of United Guardian Inc.

drug-interaction.description: Gluconic Acid may decrease effectiveness of Technetium Tc-99m oxidronate as a diagnostic agent.
